text: Yeah, I was in the boy scouts at the time. And we was doing the 50-yard dash, racing,
keypoint: I was a Boy Scout running a 50-yard dash

text: but we was at the pier, marked off, and so we was doing the 50-yard dash. There was about 8 or 9 of us, you know, going down, coming back.
keypoint: We raced on a marked-off pier with eight others

text: And, going down the third time, I caught cramps and I started yelling "Help!", but the fellows didn't believe me, you know.
keypoint: I cramped on the third run and cried for help

text: They thought I was just trying to catch up, because I was going on or slowing down. So all of them kept going. They leave me.
keypoint: The others thought I was faking and left me

text: And so I started going down. Scoutmaster was up there. He was watching me. But he didn't pay me no attention either.
keypoint: I started sinking while the scoutmaster simply watched

text: And for no reason at all there was another guy, who had just walked up that minute... He just jumped over and grabbed me.
keypoint: A passer-by suddenly jumped in and rescued me
